wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Clayton Bentley (1809–1851) was an English line-engraver and  painter.

response: * Joseph Clayton Bentley (1809–1851), English line-engraver and painter

His brother John Brandard was a lithograph artist who designed many illustrated title-pages for music.Modern English Biography: (Supplement v.1-3) p. 486, Frederic Boase (Truro 1908). His younger brother, Edward Paxman Brandard (1819–1898) was apprenticed to him while in Islington, London. Several plates by Edward also appeared in The Art Journal between 1853–87.Dictionary of nineteenth-century journalism in Great Britain and Ireland, p. 73, Laurel Brake, Marysa Demoor (2009). Another engraver who studied with Robert Brandard was Joseph Clayton Bentley.
